subject: SYSEN

notes.descrlong: Enrollment limited to: Senior or Graduate standing in an engineering field; concurrent or recent (past two years) enrollment in a group-based project with a strong system design component that is approved by a course instructor.

description: This is an advanced course in the application of the systems engineering process to the architecture design and operation of complex systems. Topics include techniques for design, simulation, optimization, and control of complex systems. Case studies and system simulations in diverse areas provide context for the application of these techniques.
catalogComments: Students majoring in Systems Engineering enroll in SYSEN 5200. Students taking the minor in Systems Engineering enroll in MAE 5920, CEE 5252, ECE 5130, or ORIE 5142. Students in distance learning programs enroll in SYSEN 5210. Course is identical for all versions.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: Applied System Engineering MAE 5910, CEE 5240, ECE 5120, ORIE 5140, SYSEN 5100 or SYSEN 5110, or permission of instructor.
catalogSatisfiesReq: Core course for Systems Engineering majors.

subject: SYSEN

notes.descrlong: This section (5210) is for Distance Learning students ONLY. Systems On campus students should enroll in SYSEN 5200. All other students should enroll in your home department corresponding section.

description: This is an advanced course in the application of the systems engineering process to the architecture design and operation of complex systems. Topics include techniques for design, simulation, optimization, and control of complex systems. Case studies and system simulations in diverse areas provide context for the application of these techniques.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: Applied Systems Engineering or permission of instructor.

subject: SYSEN
titleShort: SE Des & Oper of Reliable Sys
titleLong: Systems Engineering and Six Sigma for the Design and Operation of Reliable Systems

meetings.facilityDescr: Bill and Melinda Gates Hll G01

description: Develops skills in the design, operation and control of systems for reliable performance. Focuses on four key themes; risk analysis (with a particular emphasis on risk assessment and risk characterization), modeling system reliability (including the development of statistical models based on accelerated life testing), quality control techniques and the optimization of system design for reliability. Six Sigma Green or Blackbelt can be earned through activities associated with course. Students in distance-learning programs enroll in SYSEN 5100. Lectures are identical for all versions.
catalogComments: To take course, enroll for three credits.  Extra project work is required to earn the Six Sigma Black Belt certification.  Enroll for four credits to undertake the extra project work and earn Black Belt certification.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: SYSEN 5100 and either ENGRD 2700 or CEE 3040 or permission of instructor.
catalogSatisfiesReq: Satisfies Modeling and Analysis elective requirement.

subject: SYSEN
description: This is a weekly seminar course designed to give graduate students experience in improving their skills in presenting their research, judging peers' and field experts' research, as well as learning to accurately dissect and summarize the main points of a research talk. Being part of the Systems Engineering program, this course will strongly focus on developing the ability to present research in a broader context or as it relates to a larger system or process, and communicate the importance of the students' work to a more varied audience; a particularly important skill for both future "job talks" and grants' "importance paragraphs." Students' presentations will also include some research depth as part of developing stronger conference talks and to aid classmates in expanding their knowledge.
catalogPermission: Enrollment limited to: students in a PhD or Masters of Science Program.
